        Description copied from interface: IDataTypePersistenceHandler
        Converts a value stored in the bean into an instance of the datatype's value type.

        property - the property to which the value corresponds. Not null.

      • getScale

        public int getScale()
        Description copied from interface: IDecimalPersistenceHandler
        Gets the scale of values for this datatype. The scale is defined as the number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point for values of this datatype.
        Specified by:
        getScale in interface IDecimalPersistenceHandler

      • getPrecision

        public int getPrecision()
        Description copied from interface: IDecimalPersistenceHandler
        Gets the precision of values for this datatype. The precision is defined as the number of decimal digits required to represent this value in non-scientific notation. This number includes the IDecimalPersistenceHandler.getScale() of this datatype. For example, a decimal datatype with a precision of 10 and a scale of 2 can have at most 8 digits to the left of the decimal point (as 2 are reserved for the fractional part).
        Specified by:
        getPrecision in interface IDecimalPersistenceHandler
